content.statement: proc-035-large-bore-access is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding proc-035-large-bore-access helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of proc-035-large-bore-access include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of proc-035-large-bore-access.

definitions_glossary.preclose_technique: Deploying suture closure devices before large sheath insertion
definitions_glossary.iliofemoral_assessment: CT imaging evaluation of iliac and femoral arteries for access planning
definitions_glossary.minimum_vessel_diameter: Smallest arterial diameter along access route, limiting factor for sheath size
definitions_glossary.surgical_cutdown: Open surgical exposure as alternative to percutaneous access

contraindications: Severe circumferential calcification at access site
Prior surgery or stents limiting access

preprocedure_imaging.modality: CT angiography of aorta, iliac, and femoral arteries
measurements: Minimum diameter of external iliac artery
Minimum diameter of common iliac artery

criteria.evar: Per manufacturer IFU, typically 7-9mm for main body

sheath_insertion.wire: Stiff wire required (Lunderquist, Amplatz Super Stiff)
sheath_insertion.dilation: May need serial dilation for tight arteries
sheath_insertion.advancement: Gentle, steady pressure with fluoroscopic guidance
sheath_insertion.troubleshooting: If resistance, consider iliac conduit or alternative access

steps: Remove large sheath over wire (maintain access)
Advance preclose sutures down with pusher
Tie first suture while assistant applies proximal pressure
If still bleeding, additional ProGlide through wire access
closure.bailout: If preclose fails, surgical repair over wire access

surgical_cutdown.technique: Open femoral exposure, direct sheath insertion, primary closure

iliac_conduit.indication: Small/diseased iliofemoral with adequate iliac above
iliac_conduit.technique: Surgical graft to common iliac, access through graft

alternative_access.indication: Bilateral iliofemoral disease precluding femoral access

complications.prevention: Proper patient selection, gentle technique, adequate vessel diameter
Monitor limb perfusion during procedure, don't occlude artery too long

complications.management: Antibiotics, drainage, may need surgical repair

definition.@value: Technique of obtaining and closing large-diameter (≥12F) arterial access for advanced endovascular procedures

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the preprocedural assessment for large bore access
Perform preclose technique for large bore arteriotomy closure
Select appropriate patients for percutaneous vs surgical access
clinical_pearls: CT angiography is MANDATORY before large bore access - no exceptions
Two ProGlide devices at perpendicular orientations are standard for ≥14F
If the vessel is too small, calcified, or tortuous - do a cutdown
Always have surgical backup available - preclose doesn't always work
The minimum diameter along the entire route matters, not just at the access site
